brief_summary.textblock:
Retrospective analysis of requests of emergency hormonal contraception using pharmacy
      protocols registered in 2003 and 2006.

detailed_description.textblock:
In 2002, Levonorgestrel was introduced in Switzerland for emergency hormonal contraception
      (EC) without prescription ('pharmacist only'). In 2003, a first analysis of requests of EC
      showed that the dispensing of EC through pharmacies could successfully be implemented (Lemke
      et al 2004).

      This study was repeated three years later with the aim to explore whether the user's profile
      has changed after introduction of a low threshold access to EC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  women seaking emergency hormonal contraception

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

study_pop.textblock:
Pharmacies in Basle, Berne or Zurich, three major towns in the German speaking part of
        Switzerland, were purposively recruited if they had extended opening hours (emergency
        pharmacies) or if they were located downtown and open during traditional business hours
        (walk-in pharmacies).

        The pharmacists were asked if a pharmacy student could come to their place and photocopy
        the completed official one-page EHC written assessment forms.

clinical_study.official_title: Emergency Contraception - Observational Study of User's Profile

other_outcome.description: pharmacy status (walk-in or emergency), and the three activities of the pharmacists (performance of a pregnancy test, delivery of EHC, referral to a physician).

primary_outcome.description: questions of interest: "Did you forget to take the pill?", "Did you have any other unprotected sexual intercourse since your last period?" and "Have you ever taken the "morning-after pill" before?"

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
